paper.title: Circuits, handles, bridges and nets
paper.venue: Applications and Theory of Petri Nets
paper.abstract: This paper introduces two new structural objects for the study of nets: handles and bridges. They are shown to provide sufficient, although not necessary, conditions of good behaviour for general ordinary nets, as well as a new characterisation of structural liveness and structural boundedness for the subclass of Free Choice nets. This characterisation is used to approach a modular synthesis theory of Free Choice nets through the synchronisation of State Machines. The task is fully performed for the restricted subclass of Strict Free Choice nets introduced here.
